intro: Marcetia harleyi, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming during the rainy season. Marcetia harleyi thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
